ironclaw2e.chat.rollingSprintExtra: Modifiable by Stride ({stride}), plus can Stride afterwards
ironclaw2e.combat.sideBasedInitiativeHin: Use the default side-based initiative of Ironclaw. If set, the encounter will used the side-based initiative system, with the exact order of combatants selected from the dropdown list below. If not set, the encounter uses the alternative, more traditional initiative based on the highest die in the Initiative check and breaking ties on the second highest.
ironclaw2e.combat.sidesUsedHint: Pick the method of grouping initiatives. The initiatives will play in the order from left to right. The system to determine allies and enemies is based on token settings, neutrals grouped with enemies. In traditional mode, this will only determine who counts as enemies for the Initiative check auto-TN.
ironclaw2e.combat.manualTNHint: Set the initiative check TN manually. If set to -1, the system will do its best to automatically determine the appropriate TN based on the distance to the nearest enemy token.
ironclaw2e.combat.forceSettingsHint: Force the initiative style, side and TN settings to be used from the combat tracker rather than what the combat encounter saved into itself when the 'Begin Combat' button was pressed.
ironclaw2e.config.worldConfig.menuHint: Configure the Ironclaw 2E world-specific system settings.
ironclaw2e.config.coinageConfig.menuHint: Configure the currency settings for the world.
ironclaw2e.config.coinageConfig.menuSave: Note that for the most part, changing these settings requires actor data to be reprocessed. In practice, this requires a restart to take effect.
ironclaw2e.config.coinageConfig.currency: The singular for the currency name.
The plural for the currency name.
The weight for the currency, in grams per coin.
The value of the currency, in comparison to the base currency. A fractional value is supported with a '/' triggering the value parsing as such.
Whether the currency is shown and properly tracked for characters.
ironclaw2e.config.wildcardTemplateConfig: Configure the automatic wildcard template settings.

This menu is for configuring the automatic wildcard template settings. The way it works is that if the setting is on and a folder is set as the source for the templates, the system will attempt to match the appropriate species or career template to the token's image's name after the wildcard randomization. This way, one mook can represent multiple different species or career combinations.

The system requires that the image names that are used for the mooks or beasts have the template in the name (eg. 'Mook-Bandit-Wolf-1.png') for the system to recognize them and apply the correct species or career templates. Note that the system uses the item names of the templates, not the optional overridden name fields. The system only applies a template if the actor's respective field (Species Name or Career Name) is empty.
Right-clicking on a folder shows context menu options to set the folder as either the Species or Career template source, if the folder contains any.
Not recommended to change here directly, instead, use the folder context menu.
ironclaw2e.config.preferTokenNameHint: If checked, dice rollers will not use actor's own names and will instead use the name and presentation of their tokens, when available. Always works for synthetic actors, whereas linked actors require an active scene.
ironclaw2e.config.requireSpecialRangeFou: If checked, whenever the special bonus system tries to measure the range between the attacker and the defender, it will default to failing the check if an error happens, rather than ignoring it if an error happens.
ironclaw2e.config.manageEncumbranceAutoH: If checked, the system will automatically manage Burdened, Over-Burdened and Cannot Move statuses for actors, based on their carried weight and worn armors. Do not try to change them manually when active, doing so is likely to cause errors. Requires a restart to take effect on all actors.
ironclaw2e.config.chatButtonsHint: Whether system chat messages like weapon info messages will have quick buttons for rolls, eg. to attack with or defend against them. Recommended default is checked.
ironclaw2e.config.showDefenseButtonsHint: If checked, system chat messages will have defensive buttons visible for everyone, rather than leaving them hidden for the non-GM attacker.
ironclaw2e.config.autoInitiativeConditio: If checked, the system will automatically set the Focused and Reeling conditions to combatants based on their initiative check. Note that the Reeling from a Tie check won't be set, as that is an active choice from the player.
ironclaw2e.config.coinsHaveWeightHint: If checked, the weight of coins will be added to the encumbrance of the actor. Note that the weight of coins will be calculated and shown regardless, this setting simply controls whether the result is added to the total. Requires a restart to take effect on all actors.
ironclaw2e.config.autoPrototypeSetupHint: If checked, newly created actors will have their prototype token's attributes use type-specific defaults.
ironclaw2e.config.autoConditionRemovalHi: If checked, the system will remove conditions from actors when appropriate; eg. when attacking, when their turn ends or begins, etc.
ironclaw2e.config.autoConditionRemovalNo: If checked, the condition auto-removal system will not perform start-of-turn and end-of-turn maintenance.
ironclaw2e.config.calculateAttackEffects: Activates the attack auto-calculation system, which will calculate damage from weapon attacks and counters based on their effects and the dice rolls involved. Resisted and counter-attacks can be resolved from the context menu, as they require the opponent's roll results to properly resolve. Normal successful attacks will automatically send a chat message with the damage calculations and resolved other attacks will send it when resolved'.
ironclaw2e.config.calculateDisplaysFaile: If checked, the attack auto-calculation will also create a chat message for failed attacks with weapons, which simply note that the attack failed.
ironclaw2e.config.calculateDoesNotDispla: Auto-calculate does not display effect by default

If checked, the attack auto-calculation will not send messages to chat by default for normal attacks, requiring the user to specifically send it through the context menu. Resolving counter-attacks and resisted attacks still sends a message to chat by default.
ironclaw2e.config.diagonalRuleHint: Determines how the system measures diagonal movement on a square grid. 'Euclidean' is standard Euclidean measurement; 'Rounded Euclidean' is the same internally as 'Euclidean' but affects the behaviour of some modules, notably Drag Ruler with grid distance rounding; 'One-Two Diagonals' or as commonly known with 5ft battlemaps as 'Five-Ten Diagonals' alternates between counting diagonals as one and two squares; and 'Equidistant' will measure diagonals as just one square.
ironclaw2e.config.rangePenaltiesHint: If checked, dice pools will show an auto-calculated ranged penalty field when appropriate and possible to measure. Vertical distance is included when appropriate.
ironclaw2e.config.matchStandardRulerHint: If checked, the internal distance measurement system will use the same imprecise measuring as the standard ruler does. Unchecked, the internal system will be as precise as the floating-point math allows, which can be seen with the ruler to two-decimal precision by holding Shift.
ironclaw2e.config.allowNonGMRequestRolls: Allow Non-GM Users to request Rolls
If checked, the system will allow users without GM status to request rolls.
ironclaw2e.config.sendWeaponExhaustMessa: Send weapon gift exhaustion to chat
If checked, weapons that have a gift to auto-exhaust when used will also confirm gift exhaustion with a separate chat message.
ironclaw2e.config.showRangeCombatRulesHi: When, if ever, will the client setting 'Show range when targeting' option use combat range measurements. That is, when will height difference simply be calculated into the final result, and when will the vertical range rules apply to it.
ironclaw2e.config.showTokenExtraButtonsH: If checked, tokens will have two additional buttons underneath them, one to open the default dice pool popup, other to open the damage popup.
ironclaw2e.config.askReadyWhenUsed: Ask to ready a weapon on use
ironclaw2e.config.askReadyWhenUsedHint: If checked, weapons that automatically ready when they are used will ask to confirm it first.
ironclaw2e.config.sendWeaponReadyExhaust: Send weapon readying gift exhaustion to chat
If checked, weapons that have a gift to auto-exhaust when readied will also confirm gift exhaustion with a chat message.
ironclaw2e.config.weaponExhaustNeedsRefr: Weapons ask to refresh their gifts

If checked, weapons that have a gift to auto-exhaust will ask to refresh that gift when the weapon is used with the gift exhausted. Unchecked, the weapons will instead ignore the gift's state and work regardless.
ironclaw2e.config.npcItemHasDescriptionH: If checked, item information messages sent from characters with no player owners will have the item's description in them. Unchecked, and such messages will only show the item buttons to the players.
ironclaw2e.config.sendGiftUseExhaustMess: Send gift use exhaustion to chat
If checked, using gifts in a dice pool roll will also confirm gift exhaustion with a chat message.
ironclaw2e.config.dicePoolsSourceOrdered: If checked, the dice system auto-orders the dice based on their given source for each dice pool set, within the set the dice are ordered by size. Unchecked, the system instead orders all the dice by their size, largest first.
ironclaw2e.config.oneLineDicesOrderedHin: If checked, one line dice pools will separate each comma-separated set of dice into separate sets rather than one large set. Has no effect unless dice pools are source-ordered, in which case each set will keep its relative position. Eg. '3d8, d6, d12' will show three d8's, then a d6 and then a d12 in the roll, in that order, rather than automatically combining them and ordering them by size.
ironclaw2e.config.sparkDieAutoDwindleHin: If checked, when rolling a spark die, the system will automatically reduce it by one step if it botches. Note that this assumes that the spark die field only contains a single die set.
ironclaw2e.config.allowRerollingOthersDi: If checked, reroll bonuses that are marked as 'Allow Use on Others' can be used to reroll checks which the player does not own. Unchecked, the system does not allow it at all. Since the player will be considered the author of the reroll, they can see the entire context menu of the reroll message; this is normal and should not matter.
ironclaw2e.config.showOthersTacticsUseHi: If checked, weapon info chat messages will show the checkbox of whether attackers are going to use the Tactics skill to everyone. Unchecked, and only the GM and the player who sent the message will see the checkbox. This does not affect the automatic gift bonus checks, those will still recognize whether Tactics is being used even if it is visually hidden.
ironclaw2e.config.autoAddOnFireLightHint: If checked, actors will automatically add a flame light source on themselves when given the On Fire condition, if they have no active light source.
ironclaw2e.config.templateSpeciesActiveH: Whether the wildcard template system is active for Species.
ironclaw2e.config.templateCareerActiveHi: Whether the wildcard template system is active for Career.
ironclaw2e.config.templateSpeciesFolderH: The internal ID for the folder containing the Species templates to be used for the automatic wildcard template system.
ironclaw2e.config.templateCareerFolderHi: The internal ID for the folder containing the Career templates to be used for the automatic wildcard template system.
ironclaw2e.config.defaultSendDamageHint: If checked, the damage-applying dialog will have the 'Send to chat' option checked by default.
ironclaw2e.config.defaultSendGiftExhaust: Gift state change to chat by default
If checked, gift state changing will have the 'Send to chat' option checked by default
ironclaw2e.config.confirmItemInfoHint: If checked, the system will pop a confirmation dialog before actually sending information about items to the chat.
ironclaw2e.config.showRangeWhenTargeting: If checked, targeting a token will show a quick scrolling text that tells the current range band it is at from the controlled token. The text will also show up if either the target or the controlled token move.
ironclaw2e.config.showRangeDurationHint: How long the range band scrolling text will be visible, in milliseconds.
ironclaw2e.config.leftButtonOptionHint: The action the extra left button below a token does.
ironclaw2e.config.rightButtonOptionHint: The action the extra right button below a token does.
ironclaw2e.config.defaultSendToChat: Default item macro sends to chat
ironclaw2e.config.defaultSendToChatHint: Controls what is considered the default macro type when dragging an item to the hotbar, versus the alternate macro type which is created by holding the Quick Roll key. Checked, the default macro is sending the item information to chat. Unchecked, the default is using the item in some way.
ironclaw2e.keyConfig.quickRollModifierHi: If pressed, the system will attempt to skip dialog popups and instead make dice rolls or execute funtions immediately with default values, where available.

ironclaw2e.dialog.resistResolve.tiedMess: Original attack roll was Tied, tie needs to be broken in favor of the attacker for the successes to apply.

ironclaw2e.dialog.copyItem.title: Confirm Item Data Copy
ironclaw2e.dialog.copyItem.copySpecial: Confirm copying over these special settings to all other Gifts with the exact same name: '{name}'. WARNING: This will completely replace any existing settings!
ironclaw2e.dialog.copyItem.copyAll: Confirm copying over all data from this Gift to all other Gifts with the exact same name: '{name}'. WARNING: This will completely replace all existing data!
ironclaw2e.dialog.defense.heading: Choose defensive option against {weapon}
ironclaw2e.dialog.defense.label: Defense against {weapon}
ironclaw2e.dialog.requestRoll.rollToRequ: The Roll to request, in Dice Pool format
ironclaw2e.dialog.requestRoll.giftsToReq: Optionally, Gifts to include in the request, names separated by commas

ironclaw2e.dialog.reroll.favorRerollOneT: Favor Bonus: Reroll a One at the same time
ironclaw2e.dialog.reroll.gmIgnore: Ignoring gift special requirements, GM opened this dialog without any actors selected.
ironclaw2e.chatInfo.itemInfo.name: Name
ironclaw2e.chatInfo.itemInfo.attackBasic: Attack with {name} while skipping the Resistance step
ironclaw2e.chatInfo.damageCalcInfo.attac: Tied, if tie is broken favorably
Attack did not hit at all!
ironclaw2e.chatInfo.damageCalcInfo.resis: Resist to be added to Soak
ironclaw2e.chatInfo.damageCalcInfo.penet: Penetrating Attack, no armor for Soak
ironclaw2e.sheets.actor.applyWildcardTem: If checked, the system will attempt to give this actor the correct missing Species or Career template when dragged to the field, based on the token's wildcard image name.
ironclaw2e.sheets.actor.applyFireLight: Apply the fire as a light source
ironclaw2e.sheets.actor.details.title: Details
ironclaw2e.sheets.actor.coinage.title: Coinage
ironclaw2e.sheets.actor.status.title: Status Effects
